data.title: George Thorogood & The Destroyers: Bad All Over the World - 50 Years of Rock Tour
meta_keywords: Rock & Roll legends George Thorogood and The Destroyers are making a stop during their Bad All Over the World - 50 Years of Rock Tour on Friday
October 11 during the 2024 Big Fresno Fair!
data.meta_description: Rock & Roll legends George Thorogood and The Destroyers are making a stop during their Bad All Over the World - 50 Years of Rock Tour on Friday, October 11 during the 2024 Big Fresno Fair!
data.text:
Formed in 1973, George Thorogood and The Destroyers originally started off as a three-piece band which consisted of a guitarist, drummer and rhythm guitarist. Though the three-piece band had only rehearsed once or twice, guitarist George Thorogood and drummer Jeff Simon had been bashing out

covers of songs they loved – including “No Particular Place To Go”, “Madison Blues” and “One Bourbon, One Scotch, One Beer” – in suburban Wilmington basements since they were teens. Fast forward five decades with more than 8,000 performances and over 15 million albums later, only a few bands can still rock the house like George Thorogood and the Destroyers. The band is now formed by of George Thorogood, Jeff Simon and long-time Destroyers Bill Blough, Jim Suhler and Buddy Leach.

For the past 50 years, with no signs of slowing down, the band has performed their 50 Dates/50 States Tour; delivered landmark performances at Live Aid and on SNL, opened club gigs for Muddy Waters and stadiums for The Rolling Stones; and remain one of the most reliable/formidable live acts in the world, with 2022’s run of nearly 100 shows in 17 countries across three continents including Europe and Australia – plus a top-selling U.S. summer tour with Sammy Hagar.
